They wont show the timer for the enemy team's camps if you dont have vision on their jungle camps right?
You only get the timer if you were there for the kill, just like the minimap icon on live.
So if I see it without any monsters, i.e. the camp died 2 minutes prior to me seeing the camp, does the timer start at 3 minutes, or does it not start at all?
You don't get a timer in that case. You will only see that it is dead, until it is not dead, just like the minimap.
Is it possible to set the timers yourself? For instance, if I think the enemy finished their blue buff at 2:15, could I set the timer to go off at 7:15, despite having never been to the actual camp?
Timing jungle buffs isn't skill. Now, estimating when the opponent's buffs will be up when you didn't see it die? THAT's skill.

Wont adding jungle timers let the opponent know where you are? if i take their red buff and they see the timer start and they dont see one of their teammates over there then they know a enemy took it and people will head in that direction.

You basically built a motion sensor.
You only get the timer if you were there for the kill, just like the minimap icon on live.
What if I leave a ward at the enemy buff? Will me having vision due to a ward, automatically time the buff for me or do I need to still do something?
Good question: Since you saw the death, thanks to your ward, you'll have the timer.

The minimap icon also disappears if you pass an empty camp. What will passing an empty camp do to the new HUD addition if you weren't there for the kill? Will gaining vision on an empty camp be identical to as if you never passed the camp at all?

You will only see that the buff is not alive. Since you missed the actual time of death you don't get a respawn timer, it'll show -:-- for the timer instead. When the camp respawns it'll show up as alive, just like the minimap on live. :)

There is no drawback to adding timers in this way. All you're removing is the annoying need to type out in chat the time of a camp kill you were there for which is NOTHING but repetitive busy work that is neither fun nor challenging, just annoying.
I feel that adding the Jungle Timers at the top of the screen is not a good idea. I feel like people need to learn the timers and learn to keep track of them.

You still have to keep track of them yourself. But typing "12:20 tb" and pressing Z to check up on it is really no different from pressing Tab and looking at the top of the screen. In fact, inferring your opponents' timers based on their buffs' remaining duration even though you didn't see them is still a skill you're going to have to retain.

Duuude!! This article is dank, really well written! I fully support the stylistic changes Riot is moving towards both in game and as a company.
These changes are awesome, keep it up Riot!

All of you people whining about how you had to learn jungle timers and other people won't apparently have no imagination. While the timers will make the jungle more accessible to inexperienced players--which is, actually, almost always a good thing from a design perspective and only bad from a crotchety old man's "get-off-my-lawn" perspective--there is still a world of difference between somebody who has to look for the timers and then react and somebody who has them memorized and is already moving into position based on available information. This is the difference between the actual skill--jungling--and the "skill"--memorizing timers.

Also, this discussion completely ignores the fact that many people have been using non-CV third-party programs to track jungle timers for ages, in no small part because there are so many camps to keep track of that it legitimately might not be possible for some players otherwise. Putting it into the basic game setup allows such players to participate at the same level without having to dip into gray areas for the privilege.
